title: Child visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 802 Child visa, which allows an eligible child to stay in Australia permanently with their parent. It outlines eligibility requirements, costs, application steps, processing times, rights and obligations, and related conditions for applicants.

structured_data.description: This visa allows a child to stay in Australia permanently and live with their parents.

important_updates.from_23_july_2025: Applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount.
important_updates.cannot_import_note: Some existing applications made outside Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.
important_updates.reference_link: Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications

stay_details.permanent_residency_grant_date: The day the visa is granted

conditions: Unlimited travel to and from Australia during the 5-year period
After 5 years, the child must apply for a Resident Return Visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Australian citizenship removes the need for a visa to re-enter Australia

what_the_visa_allows: Enrol in Australia's public healthcare scheme, Medicare
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English language classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)

dependency_requirement.stepchild_exclusion: A child does not meet the dependency requirement if the stepparent is the current spouse or de facto partner of the child’s biological or adopted parent.

age_and_status: A full-time student aged over 18 and under 25
Over 18 and unable to work due to a disability
eligibility.marital_status: Must be single and dependent on the parent
location_requirements: Must be in Australia when the application is made and when the decision is made
eligibility.visa_condition_restriction: Cannot apply if holding a visa with a 'no further stay' condition

adoption_requirements.general_rule: Adoption must be finalised before the child turns 18.
adoption_timing: Adoption may occur before or after the parent becomes an Australian citizen, permanent resident or eligible New Zealand citizen.
if_adopted_after_parent_became_eligible: Must be through intercountry adoption involving an Australian state or territory central authority
Or through intercountry adoption between two Hague Convention countries
Or through expatriate adoption by an eligible Australian or NZ citizen/permanent resident living overseas, with conditions not fully shown due to truncated text

including_family.applying_siblings: Each sibling must submit a separate application.

dependent_children_of_child.can_be_included: Dependent children can be included at application or before decision.
dependent_children_of_child.health_requirements: Dependants applying must meet health requirements; non-migrating family members may also need to meet health requirements.

additional_charges: Additional charge for each dependent child applying
costs.pricing_estimator_note: The Visa Pricing Estimator does not include additional costs.

apply_from.location_requirement: The child must be in Australia but not in immigration clearance.
apply_from.restrictions: The child cannot apply if holding a visa with a no further stay condition.

processing_times.guide_tool_reference: Processing time guide tool shows recent processing times, not specific to your application.
factors_that_may_delay_application: Missing documents or need for more information
processing_times.payment_requirement: Application cannot be processed without the correct visa application charge.
processing_times.contact_method: Department will contact using authorised communication method

obligations.general_obligations: The child and any dependants must obey all Australian laws.

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to the child's passport; no physical label provided.

help_with_application.guidance_note: Before paying someone for help, applicants should read information on who can assist with visa applications.
